  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovered damaged in unload.outer container had closures open and was wet.upon inspection bottes was shattered leaking out full contents. DescribePack: failure was due to package being dropped. DescribePack: failure was due to loose cap causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: fold absorb was used to address spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report I-2023090095
item.description:
Report I-2023090095

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: Baltimore
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Minibulk Driver was unloading hydrochloric acid into a tank when the driver noticed the product was leaking out of a 55-gallon drum that was being used as an overflow tank. A valve on the customers tank was left open and the product was flowing into the overflow drum which had a crack in the bottom of it. The driver then shut off his valves from the truck to stop the unloading process to allow customer to close the valve. The product was flowing out of the cracked drum onto a concrete pad for 5 minutes. The customer took responsibility for the release and replaced the cracked drum to ensure there would not be a release in the future if the overflow tank would be utilized. The product was used in the cleaning process of the concrete pad where it was spilled.

item.title: Report E-2023090512
item.description:
Report E-2023090512

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-20
  • City: BOWIE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was stopped at a red light at the intersection of Annapolis Road and Crane Highway near Bowie, Maryland when another vehicle struck the rear end of the tank trailer. Due to the extent of damage to the trailer, the gasoline needed to be transferred into another trailer. During the course of the transfer, approximately 1 gallon of gasoline was released. First Call Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023081674
item.description:
Report X-2023081674

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING THE PACKAGE ONTO A PD VEHICLE WHEN THEY NOTICED THAT THERE WAS LEAKAGE OF THE MATERIAL ON THE OVERPACK. OPS MANAGER ARIF ZOULKARNI WAS NOTIFIED, PLACED THE PAKCAGE IN A LINED HAZ TOTE AND TRANSFERED IT TO THE DISGNATED AREA FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS. DescribePack: THE LOOSE CAP OF THE JERRICAN WAS DETERMINED TO BE THE MAIN CONTRIBUTING FACTOR TO THE RELEASE OF THE HAZARDOUDS MATERIAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZ TOTE AND WAS REMOVED FROM THE VAN LINE.

  • Description: 1. X-2023081593 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED STAINED AND LEAKING DURING THE UNLOADING PROCESS. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT BOTH BOTTLES INSIDE WERE NOT SECURE AND HAD LEAKED OUT FROM LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN LINED HAZMAT TOTE. 2. X-2023081594 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED STAINED/LEAKING ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WHILE UNLOADING. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE BOTTLE HAD LEAKED DUE TO A LOOSE CAP AND THERE WAS NOTHING TO SECURE THE INNER CONTENTS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN LINED HAZMAT TOTE
